speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms have you been experiencing besides fatigue, abdominal pain, night sweats, weight loss, and the enlarged supraclavicular lymph node?

speaker: Patient
text: I've also been feeling an unusual fullness in my belly area, and it's been difficult to wear my usual clothing because of it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your bowel habits, such as diarrhea or constipation?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any significant changes in my bowel habits. Everything seems pretty normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fever or chills recently?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any fever or chills lately. Just the fatigue and other symptoms I've mentioned.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections or illnesses that you are aware of?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections or illnesses that I can recall. Just these ongoing symptoms for the past few weeks.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any skin changes, such as rashes, itching, or unusual bruising?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any skin changes like rashes or unusual bruising. My skin seems normal to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to anyone who has been sick?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled recently, and I don't recall being around anyone who was sick.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any significant changes in your appetite or dietary habits recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I've definitely noticed a decrease in my appetite. I just don't feel like eating as much as I used to.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any pain or discomfort in your chest or difficulty breathing?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any chest pain or difficulty breathing. My main concerns are the abdominal pain and the other symptoms I've mentioned.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any swelling in your legs or abdomen, or any changes in your urine output?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any swelling in my legs, but my abdomen does feel swollen and uncomfortable. My urine output seems normal, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests done, and if so, what were the results?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent blood tests done. I'm not sure what the results would be if I did.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your sleep patterns, aside from the night sweats?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling more tired during the day, and I find it hard to get a good night's sleep because of the night sweats. Overall, my sleep quality has definitely declined.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any lumps or swelling in other areas of your body, aside from the supraclavicular lymph node?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any other lumps or swelling in different areas, just the neck swelling that developed recently.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any history of cancer or any family history of cancer in your family?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have any personal history of cancer, and as far as I know, there's no significant family history of it either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any joint pain or stiffness in your body?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't experienced any joint pain or stiffness. My main issues are really focused on the abdominal pain and the other symptoms I've mentioned.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent weight changes aside from the weight loss you've mentioned? For example, have you been gaining weight in any specific areas?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any weight gain in specific areas; it's mostly just the weight loss I've mentioned. My clothes feel looser overall, especially around my abdomen.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your menstrual cycle or any unusual bleeding if applicable?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm a male, so I don't have a menstrual cycle or experience any bleeding like that.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent imaging studies, such as an ultrasound or CT scan of your abdomen?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent imaging studies done, so I'm not sure what they would show.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Abdominal_CT_Scan. I would like to get an abdominal CT scan to evaluate the fullness in your belly and check for any abnormalities that could explain your symptoms.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Slight abdominal distension noted on inspection, dullness over the left lower quadrant on percussion, and splenomegaly detected without rebound tenderness. CT scan findings show massively enlarged axillary, mediastinal, and cervical lymph nodes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on the CT scan results showing massively enlarged lymph nodes and your symptoms, have you experienced any recent exposure to known allergens or toxins, or have you been in contact with anyone who has had similar symptoms?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been exposed to any known allergens or toxins recently, and I don't know anyone with similar symptoms. My environment at work is pretty standard for construction, and I haven't noticed anything unusual.

speaker: Doctor
text: DIAGNOSIS READY: Lymphoma.
